title: Keane "Under The Iron Sea" album cover type
content:
Hello,

I know this one’s probably pretty easy, but I can’t seem to locate it.

Thanks for any help you can offer with identifying it!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20090619091717im_/http:/typophile.com/files/SannaAnnukka_1_5969.png)
author: abstracttruth

comments.content:
\> _I know this one’s probably pretty easy, (...)_

Nope, it’s not. :^)

But based on something I’ve seen . . . I think.

?

Firstly are you going to admit that you actually own a Keane CD!!

OK, there was a lot in the UK design press a about a year ago regarding this cover design, so google Creative Review, Grafik magazine maybe? Design was by Big Active. Illustrator Sanna Annukka.

If memory serves the whole marketing roll out was a tightly managed ’branding’ job. I’m fairly sure that the type was drawn especially, its not impossible that it is an adaption of an existing font.

Not much help I know.

:-)

No, can’t say i own a Keane CD.

Came across it on Big Active’s website and grabbed a screenshot for my “Inspiration” file. Really nice work overall, in my opinion.

Yeah, probably is a custom adaptation of an exisitng typeface.

Thanks for the suggestions!

Great type, great illustration, great album.

I suspect they started with [Avant Garde Extra Light](http://web.archive.org/web/20090619091717/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/itc-avant-garde-gothic/extra-light/)
